results.name: A fractal tree, read by rows: for n > 1: T(n,0) = T(n-1,0)+2, T(n,2*n) = T(n-1,0)+3, and for k=1..2*n-1: T(n,k) = T(n-1,k-1).
comment: If all pairs of consecutive terms (i,i+1) (such as (0,1), (1,2), (2,3), ...) are erased, the original sequence appears; see also A253607.
reference: V. A. Sankar Ponnapalli and V. Y. Jayasree Pappu, Design of Octagonal Fractal Array Antenna for Side Lobe Reduction with Morse-Thue Fractal Density Tapering Technique, Preprint, 2016.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
Éric Angelini, More fractal trees - and erasures, SeqFan list, Jan 04 2015.
mathematica: a[n_, k_] := 2 Abs[n-k] - Boole[k<n]; Table[a[n, k], {n, 0, 9}, {k, 0, 2 n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 04 2016, after _M. F. Hasler_ *)
program: f xs@(x:_) = ys : f ys where ys = [x + 2] ++ xs ++ [x + 3]
